<table border="1" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="5" width="650">
  <thead>
    <tr>
      <th>ID</th>
      <td>UC-1</td>
      <th>Name</th>
      <td>register</td>
      <th>Package</th>
      <td>User Management</td>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <td colspan="2" width="100"><b>Actors</b></td>
      <td colspan="4">Guest</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td colspan="2"><b>Goal</b></td>
      <td colspan="4">Register a new user account.</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td colspan="2"><b>Preconditions</b></td>
      <td colspan="4">The desired user name and email are not already registered.</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td colspan="2"><b>Basic flow</b></td>
      <td colspan="4"> 
      
<OL>
<LI>The guest chooses _register_</LI>
<LI>The system displays a form
<UL>
<LI>name _(required, minimum number of characters: 3)_</LI>
<LI>e-mail address _(required, valid structure of e-mail address, must be unique)_</LI>
<LI>password _(At least 5 characters)_</LI>
</UL></LI>
<Li>The user confirms his entries with _Submit_</Li>
<LI>The system saves the new user account</LI>
</OL>
      
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td colspan="2"><b>Variations</b></td>
      <td colspan="4">Displays an error message if any of the previously mentioned constraints is violated. It is possible to recover from such an error by undoing the previous action, e.g. clearing the input field.</td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td colspan="2"><b>Postconditions</b></td>
      <td colspan="4"></td>
    </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>
